artemis 0.9.0

    ARTEMIS Installation Guide

    artemis-installation-guide.Rmd


    The easiest way to install artemis is from one of the pre-compiled binaries on the artemis releases page. To do this, run the R code for your specific platform below:

    # MacOSX
install.packages("https://github.com/fishsciences/artemis/releases/download/v0.9/artemis_0.9.0_R_OSX.tgz",
                 repos = NULL)

# LINUX
install.packages("https://github.com/fishsciences/artemis/releases/download/v0.9/artemis_0.9.0_R_x86_64-pc-linux-gnu.tar.gz", 
                 repos = NULL)

# Windows
install.packages("https://github.com/fishsciences/artemis/releases/download/v0.9/artemis.zip", 
                 repos = NULL)


    If you’re set up to build compiled code from source on your machine, you can use also the devtools package to build artemis from its source on GitHub. If you don’t know whether your system is set up to do this, try running devtools::has_devel().


    If you see the message “Your system is ready to build packages!”, and you’re on Windows, we still recommend installing from the pre-compiled binary. If you’re on MacOS or Linux, then go ahead and install from source however you like to do that (the install_github() function from the devtools package, utils::install.packages("path-to-.tz", type = "source"), R CMD INSTALL, etc.

    MacOS or Linux from source using devtools::install_github() 

    devtools::install_github("fishsciences/artemis", build_vignettes = FALSE) # you can change to TRUE if you want to launch the vignettes from R, but note that install will be slower.

    If you have sub-architecture you’re really in to customizing on install, the source code is here, go nuts.
